[30;1m688 | [0m[35mAn *access rights* callback is a user-defined function that is called when the[0m
[30;1m689 | [0m[35maccess rights - read/write permissions - of a PV undergo changes. The callback[0m
[30;1m690 | [0m[35mwill be invoked upon successful initialization and at all events that change[0m
[30;1m691 | [0m[35ma PV's access rights, including disconnection and reconnection events.[0m
[30;1m692 | [0m[35mAn *access rights* callback can be specified when a PV is created, or can be[0m
[30;1m693 | [0m[35madded by appending to the :attr:`access_callbacks` list of the PV object.[0m

[30;1m240 | [0m[35m.. method:: clear_auto_monitor()[0m
[30;1m241 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m242 | [0m[35m   turn off automatic monitoring of a PV.  Note that this will suspend[0m
[30;1m243 | [0m[35m   all event callbacks on a PV at the CA level by calling[0m
[30;1m244 | [0m[35m   :func:`epics.ca.clear_subscription`, but will not clear the list of PVs[0m
[30;1m245 | [0m[35m   callbacks.  This means that doing :meth:`reconnect` will resume[0m
[30;1m246 | [0m[35m   event processing including any callbacks or the PV.[0m

[30;1m699 | [0m[35mPut with wait, put callbacks, and  put_complete[0m
[30;1m700 | [0m[35m========================================================[0m
[30;1m701 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m702 | [0m[35mSome EPICS records take a significant amount of time to fully process, and[0m

[30;1m705 | [0m[35mthe processing is done::[0m

[30;1m125 | [0m[35m* user callbacks - user-supplied Python function(s) that are run when a PV's[0m
[30;1m126 | [0m[35m  value, access rights, or connection status changes[0m

[30;1m27 | [0m[35m(with Python objects) to the EPICS Channnel Access (CA) protocol.  Python's[0m
[30;1m28 | [0m[35mctypes library is used to wrap the basic CA functionality, with higher[0m

[30;1m30 | [0m[35madvantages including no need for extension code written in C, better[0m

[30;1m3 | [0m[35mEpics Channel Access for Python[0m
[30;1m4 | [0m[35m=====================================[0m
[30;1m5 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m6 | [0m[35mPyEpics is an interface for the Channel Access (CA) library of the `Epics[0m
[30;1m7 | [0m[35mControl System <https://epics-controls.org/>`_ to the Python Programming[0m
[30;1m8 | [0m[35mlanguage.  The pyepics package provides an :mod:`epics` module to python,[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35mwith methods for reading from and writing to Epics Process Variables (PVs)[0m
[30;1m10 | [0m[35mvia the CA protocol.  The package includes a thin and fairly complete layer[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m229[0m[34m of [0m[33m886[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m313 | [0m[35mThe most explicit use of contexts is to put :func:`epics.ca.create_context`[0m
[30;1m314 | [0m[35mat the start of each function call as a thread target, and[0m
[30;1m315 | [0m[35m:func:`epics.ca.destroy_context` at the end of each thread.  This will[0m
[30;1m316 | [0m[35mcause all the activity in that thread to be done in its own context.  This[0m
[30;1m317 | [0m[35mworks, but means more care is needed, and so is not the recommended.[0m
[30;1m318 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m241 | [0m[35msome time for this communication to happen.   With[0m

[30;1m110 | [0m[35mPV, this takes very close to 30 milliseconds for each PV.  That is, for 1000[0m

[30;1m16 | [0m[35mThe *get* functions, :func:`epics.caget`, :func:`pv.get` and :func:`epics.ca.get`[0m
[30;1m17 | [0m[35mall ask for data to be transferred over the network.  For large data arrays[0m
[30;1m18 | [0m[35mor slow networks, this can can take a noticeable amount of time.  For PVs[0m
[30;1m19 | [0m[35mthat have been disconnected, the *get* call will fail to return a value at[0m
[30;1m20 | [0m[35mall.  For this reason, these functions all take a `timeout` keyword option.[0m
[30;1m21 | [0m[35mThe lowest level :func:`epics.ca.get` also has a `wait` option, and a companion[0m
[30;1m22 | [0m[35mfunction :func:`epics.ca.get_complete`.  This section describes the details of[0m
[30;1m23 | [0m[35mthese.[0m

[30;1m322 | [0m[35mfunction that will be called by :meth:`Thread.run`.  Equivalently, you can[0m
[30;1m323 | [0m[35madd a :func:`withInitialContext` decorator to the function.  Creating a PV[0m
[30;1m324 | [0m[35mobject will implicitly do this for you, as long as it is your first CA[0m
[30;1m325 | [0m[35maction in the function.  Each time you do a :meth:`PV.get` or[0m
[30;1m326 | [0m[35m:meth:`PV.put` (or a few other methods), it will also check that the initial[0m
[30;1m327 | [0m[35mcontext is being used.[0m
[30;1m328 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m244 | [0m[35mthat CA events can happen at any time, and :meth:`epics.ca.pend_event` does not[0m
[30;1m245 | [0m[35mneed to be called to explicitly allow for event processing.[0m
[30;1m246 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m247 | [0m[35mStill, some time must be released from the main Python thread on occasion[0m
[30;1m248 | [0m[35min order for events to be processed.  The simplest way to do this is with[0m
[30;1m249 | [0m[35m:meth:`time.sleep`, so that an event loop can simply be::[0m
[30;1m250 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m238 | [0m[35m================================[0m
[30;1m239 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m240 | [0m[35mIn order for a program to communicate with Epics devices, it needs to allow[0m
[30;1m241 | [0m[35msome time for this communication to happen.   With[0m
[30;1m242 | [0m[35m:data:`epics.ca.PREEMPTIVE_CALLBACK` set to  ``True``, this communication  will[0m
[30;1m243 | [0m[35mbe handled in a thread separate from the main Python thread.  This means[0m
[30;1m244 | [0m[35mthat CA events can happen at any time, and :meth:`epics.ca.pend_event` does not[0m

[30;1m128 | [0m[35mCan it be improved further?  The answer is Yes, but at a price.  For the[0m
[30;1m129 | [0m[35mdiscussion here, we'll call the original version "Method 0" and the method of[0m
[30;1m130 | [0m[35mcreating all the PVs then getting their values "Method 1".  With both of these[0m
[30;1m131 | [0m[35mapproaches, the script has fully connected PV objects for all PVs named, so[0m
[30;1m132 | [0m[35mthat subsequent use of these PVs will be very efficient.[0m

[30;1m26 | [0m[35mtimeout value.  If the value returned is ``None``, then either the PV has[0m
[30;1m27 | [0m[35mtruly disconnected or the timeout passed before receiving the value.  If[0m

[30;1m22 | [0m[35mfunction :func:`epics.ca.get_complete`.  This section describes the details of[0m
[30;1m23 | [0m[35mthese.[0m
[30;1m24 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m25 | [0m[35mIf you're using :func:`epics.caget` or :func:`pv.get` you can supply a[0m
[30;1m26 | [0m[35mtimeout value.  If the value returned is ``None``, then either the PV has[0m
[30;1m27 | [0m[35mtruly disconnected or the timeout passed before receiving the value.  If[0m
[30;1m28 | [0m[35mthe *get* is incomplete, in that the PV is connected but the data has[0m
[30;1m29 | [0m[35msimply not been received yet, a subsequent :func:`epics.caget` or[0m

[30;1m31 | [0m[35mEpics for other applications.  One notable example is if you are using[0m
[30;1m32 | [0m[35mpyepics within a Python program or application that has already loaded a[0m
[30;1m33 | [0m[35mversion of libca, as a single process can load only one version of a shared[0m
[30;1m34 | [0m[35mlibrary.  If you are using the `pcaspy` library or running a python script[0m
[30;1m35 | [0m[35mthat loads pyepics from within an epics IOC, you will need to ensure that all[0m
[30;1m36 | [0m[35mlibraries loading libca load exactly the same version.[0m

[30;1m146 | [0m[35mThe Python :mod:`epics.ca` module defines a variable[0m
[30;1m147 | [0m[35m:data:`epics.ca.AUTOMONITOR_MAXLENGTH` which controls whether array PVs are[0m
[30;1m148 | [0m[35mautomatically monitored.  The default value for this variable is 65536, but[0m
[30;1m149 | [0m[35mcan be changed at runtime.  Arrays with fewer elements than[0m
[30;1m150 | [0m[35m:data:`epics.ca.AUTOMONITOR_MAXLENGTH` will be automatically monitored,[0m
[30;1m151 | [0m[35munless explicitly set, and arrays larger than[0m
[30;1m152 | [0m[35m:data:`epics.ca.AUTOMONITOR_MAXLENGTH` will not be automatically monitored[0m

[30;1m138 | [0m[35mThe other main issue for PVs holding large arrays is whether they should be[0m
[30;1m139 | [0m[35mautomatically monitored.  For PVs holding scalar data or small arrays, any[0m
[30;1m140 | [0m[35mpenalty for automatically monitoring these variables (that is, causing[0m
[30;1m141 | [0m[35mnetwork traffic every time a PV changes) is a small price to pay for being[0m
[30;1m142 | [0m[35massured that the latest value is always available.  As arrays get larger[0m
[30;1m143 | [0m[35m(as for data streams from Area Detectors), it is less obvious that[0m
[30;1m144 | [0m[35mautomatic monitoring is desirable.[0m

[30;1m53 | [0m[35mmechanism, and the :func:`restore_pvs` function can read and restore values[0m
[30;1m54 | [0m[35musing save files from autosave.  Note, however, that the purpose here is[0m
[30;1m55 | [0m[35mquite different from that of the standard autosave module (which is[0m

[30;1m116 | [0m[35mIf you have `procServ` installed, you can do::[0m
[30;1m117 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m118 | [0m[35m     ~> cd tests/Setup[0m
[30;1m119 | [0m[35m     ~> bash ./start_ioc.sh[0m
[30;1m120 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m121 | [0m[35mwhich will put the IOC properly as a background process. Second, run the[0m

[30;1m64 | [0m[35m~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[0m
[30;1m65 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m66 | [0m[35mPyepics will find and load the Channel Access dynamic library (*libca.so*,[0m
[30;1m67 | [0m[35m*libca.dylib*, or *ca.dll* depending on the system) at runtime in order to[0m
[30;1m68 | [0m[35mactually work.  For the most commonly used operating systems and[0m
[30;1m69 | [0m[35marchitectures, modern version of these libraries are provided, and will be[0m
[30;1m70 | [0m[35minstalled and used with pyepics.  We strongly recommend using these.[0m

[30;1m5 | [0m[35mPrerequisites[0m
[30;1m6 | [0m[35m~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[0m
[30;1m7 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m8 | [0m[35mPyEpics works with Python version 3.8 and higher.  At this writing,[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35mautomated testing is done with versions 3.8 through 3.12,[0m
[30;1m10 | [0m[35mPyEpics may still work with Python 3.7 or even 3.6, but no testing or support[0m
[30;1m11 | [0m[35mis available for these.[0m

[30;1m63 | [0m[35mGetting Started, Setting up the Epics Environment[0m
[30;1m64 | [0m[35m~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~[0m
[30;1m65 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m66 | [0m[35mPyepics will find and load the Channel Access dynamic library (*libca.so*,[0m
[30;1m67 | [0m[35m*libca.dylib*, or *ca.dll* depending on the system) at runtime in order to[0m
[30;1m68 | [0m[35mactually work.  For the most commonly used operating systems and[0m
[30;1m69 | [0m[35marchitectures, modern version of these libraries are provided, and will be[0m

[30;1m349 | [0m[35m   The initial default value is *dbr.DBE_ALARM|dbr.DBE_VALUE*[0m
[30;1m350 | [0m[35m   (i.e. update on alarm changes or value changes which exceeds the[0m
[30;1m351 | [0m[35m   monitor deadband.)  The other possible flag in the bitmask is[0m
[30;1m352 | [0m[35m   *dbr.DBE_LOG* for archive-deadband changes.[0m
[30;1m353 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m145 | [0m[35m.. data:: PREEMPTIVE_CALLBACK[0m
[30;1m146 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m147 | [0m[35m   sets whether preemptive callbacks will be used.  The default value is[0m
[30;1m148 | [0m[35m   ``True``.  If you wish to run without preemptive callbacks this variable[0m
[30;1m149 | [0m[35m   *MUST* be set before any other use of the CA library.  With preemptive[0m
[30;1m150 | [0m[35m   callbacks enabled, EPICS communication will not require client code to[0m
[30;1m151 | [0m[35m   continually poll for changes.   With preemptive callback disables,  you[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m422[0m[34m of [0m[33m886[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m122 | [0m[35mfinalizing the CA session, so that core-dumps and warning messages do not[0m

[30;1m124 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m126 | [0m[35mfinalization process, the detailed steps will be described here.  These[0m
[30;1m127 | [0m[35minitialization and finalization tasks are handled in the following way:[0m
[30;1m128 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m423[0m[34m of [0m[33m886[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000700[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.DataExfiltration[0m
  Severity: [36mImportant[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/pyepics-3.5.7/epics/ca.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m\.(request|post|get)\([0m
[30;1m1920 | [0m[35m    """return list of names for ENUM states of a Channel.  Returns[0m
[30;1m1921 | [0m[35m    None for non-ENUM Channels"""[0m
[30;1m1922 | [0m[35m    if field_type(chid) == dbr.ENUM:[0m
[30;1m1923 | [0m[35m        return get_ctrlvars(chid).get('enum_strs', None)[0m

[30;1m1559 | [0m[35m    be received over the network before returning ``None``.  Such a timeout[0m
[30;1m1560 | [0m[35m    could imply that the channel is disconnected or that the data size is[0m

[30;1m1563 | [0m[35m    later with :func:`get_complete`.[0m

[30;1m525 | [0m[35mlibraries, and requires no compiled code for the bridge between Python and[0m
[30;1m526 | [0m[35mthe CA library.  This makes it very easy to wrap essentially all of CA from[0m
[30;1m527 | [0m[35mPython code, and support multiple platforms.  Since ctypes loads a shared[0m
[30;1m528 | [0m[35mobject library at runtime, the underlying CA library can be upgraded[0m
[30;1m529 | [0m[35mwithout having to re-build the Python wrapper. The ctypes interface[0m
[30;1m530 | [0m[35mprovides the most reliable thread-safety available, as each call to the[0m
[30;1m531 | [0m[35munderlying C library is automatically made thread-aware without explicit[0m

[30;1m387 | [0m[35m..  function:: camonitor(pvname[, writer=None[, callback=None]])[0m
[30;1m388 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m389 | [0m[35m  This `sets a monitor` on the named PV, which will cause *something* to be[0m
[30;1m390 | [0m[35m  done each time the value changes.  By default the PV name, time, and[0m
[30;1m391 | [0m[35m  value will be printed out (to standard output) when the value changes,[0m

[30;1m330 | [0m[35metc) to move or because it triggers a complex calculation or data[0m
[30;1m331 | [0m[35mprocessing sequence.  The *timeout* argument gives the maximum time to[0m
[30;1m332 | [0m[35mwait, in seconds.  The function will return after this (approximate) time[0m
[30;1m333 | [0m[35meven if the :func:`caput` has not completed.[0m
[30;1m334 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m335 | [0m[35mThis function returns 1 on success.  It will return ``None`` if the timeout[0m
[30;1m336 | [0m[35mhas been exceeded.[0m

[30;1m58 | [0m[35midentical messages.   To prevent this situation, the alarm callback will be[0m
[30;1m59 | [0m[35mcalled when the alarm condition is met **and** the callback was not called[0m
[30;1m60 | [0m[35mwithin the time specified by  :attr:`alert_delay`.[0m
[30;1m61 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m62 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m63 | [0m[35mAlarm Example[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m757[0m[34m of [0m[33m886[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/pyepics-3.5.7/doc/alarm.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m24 | [0m[35m   :type callback: callable or None[0m
[30;1m25 | [0m[35m   :param alert_delay:  time (in seconds) to wait before executing another alarm callback.[0m
[30;1m26 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m27 | [0m[35mThe alarm works by checking the value of the PV each time it changes.  If[0m
[30;1m28 | [0m[35mthe new value is outside the acceptable range (violates the trip point),[0m
[30;1m29 | [0m[35mthen the user-supplied callback function is run.  This callback could be[0m
[30;1m30 | [0m[35mset do send a message or to take some other course of action.[0m
